Key Match Events: The Hornets held a narrow 47-46 lead at halftime
Charlotte finished the second quarter with an 18-6 run, taking advantage of Cunningham being sidelined due to foul trouble
Seth Curry sparked the rally with a three-point play, and Bridges capped off the run by picking off a pass and hitting a 31-foot 3-pointer at the buzzer
Post-Match Reflections: With this win, Detroit continues to show resilience in the absence of key players and keeps their momentum going as they push forward in the NBA season
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win marks Detroit's fifth victory in their last six games
Others: Tobias Harrisâ€™ double-double performance of 24 points and 10 rebounds
Cade Cunningham contributed 18 points for the Pistons
Malik Beasley added 12 points off the bench
Tim Hardaway Jr. chipped in with 11 points
Jalen Duren provided a solid presence in the paint, adding 10 points and 14 rebounds
Miles Bridges led the Hornets with 20 points, nine rebounds, and five assists
Mark Williams also contributed with 18 points and nine rebounds in the losing effort
